server

Interface HTTPServer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MyHTTPServer

    public interface HTTPServer
extends java.lang.Runnable
    Minimal HTTP/1.1 server abstraction.

    Implementation note: MyHTTPServer is the default implementation that ships with this project. Nothing prevents you from creating an alternative implementation (for example based on NIO) as long as it fulfils this contract.

    Typical usage

    
 HTTPServer server = new MyHTTPServer(8080, 4);
 server.addServlet("GET", "/static/", new HtmlLoader("html_files"));
 server.start();
 // ... later ...
 server.close();

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Runnable

        run

    • Method Detail

      • addServlet

        void addServlet(java.lang.String httpCommanmd,
                java.lang.String uri,
                Servlet s)
        Register a servlet for requests that start with the given URI prefix. If multiple servlets match one URI, the longest prefix wins.
        Parameters:
        httpCommanmd - HTTP method ("GET", "POST", ...)
        uri - leading part of the path, e.g. "/api/" (trailing slash recommended)
        s - servlet instance responsible for those requests

      • removeServlet

        void removeServlet(java.lang.String httpCommanmd,
                   java.lang.String uri)
        Remove a previously-registered servlet.
        Parameters:
        httpCommanmd - HTTP method
        uri - URI prefix used during registration

      • start

        void start()
        Start listening for incoming connections. Implementations are expected to spawn their own thread(s) so this call usually returns immediately.

      • close

        void close()
        Stop the server and release all underlying resources.
